body.p:
The Current-Limiting Reactor is a stand-alone unit with no operational controls. Switching to reserve power occurs at the downstream RPP Bypass Cabinet. For operational procedures on switching downstream RPPs to reserve power, see these companion Eaton manuals:
Reactor Power Panel V2 (250A) Installation and Operation P-164001118
Retrofit Bypass Cabinet for Reactor Power Panels (250A) Installation and Operation P-164001119

Cable entry can be from top or bottom of the unit. An Current-Limiting Reactor can also have an optional side car that provides additional cable entry space for conduit. The side car allows already installed floor conduit to align with the unit. See .
Left and right front panel doors enable infrared scanning from the front of the unit.
The 2500A Current-Limiting Reactor has the same cabinet and dimensions as the 2000A Current-Limiting Reactor.

fig.title: Current-Limiting Reactor 2000A or 2500A, Front and Side Views
